text: Harold Sidney Crawford (7 October 1887 – 1979) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper in the Football League for Millwall, Reading and Woolwich Arsenal. == Personal life == Crawford served as a private in Transport section of the Army Service Corps during the First World War. == Career statistics == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+Appearances and goals by club, season and competition ! rowspan="2" |Club ! rowspan="2" |Season ! colspan="3" |League ! colspan="2" |National Cup ! colspan="2" |Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- | rowspan="3" |Woolwich Arsenal |1911–12 | rowspan="2" |First Division |7 |0 |1 |0 |8 |0 |- |1912–13 |19 |0 |0 |0 |19 |0 |- ! colspan="2" |Total !26 !0 !1 !0 !27 !0 |- | rowspan="4" |Millwall |1922–23 | rowspan="3" |Third Division South |13 |0 |0 |0 |13 |0 |- |1923–24 |33 |0 |1 |0 |34 |0 |- |1924–25 |32 |0 |1 |0 |33 |0 |- ! colspan="2" |Total !77 !0 !2 !0 !79 !0 |- ! colspan="3" |Career total !103 !0 !3 !0 !106 !0 |} == References == Category:Scottish footballers Category:Reading F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Southern Football League players Category:Arsenal F.C. players Category:British Army personnel of World War I Category:1887 births Category:1979 deaths Category:Footballers from Dundee Category:Newcastle United F.C. players Category:Hebburn Argyle F.C. players Category:Millwall F.C. players Category:Workington A.F.C. players Category:Royal Army Service Corps soldiers
title: Sidney Crawford (footballer)
